text: <http://thecolorsofmotion.com/films>

attachments.title: The Colors Of Motion
attachments.text: A visualization of the use of color in moving images, with a focus on film. The average color of each frame is extracted and presented in a highly interactive way.
attachments.fallback: The Colors of Motion: The Colors Of Motion

text: Beautiful.
A bit annoyed with it b/c I was doing something similar for one of my animation experiments. :wink:
hah. the same guy also did <http://thecolorsoftwitter.com/>

text: (me) > :weary: :gun: < (iPhone 6+)
Why?
Everytime I think I have it figured out something gets fucked up through photoshop and then I feel like I don't know what I'm doing anymore.
<http://i.imgur.com/JkoAyrx.jpg>
whahappen?
Ha. That's me 24x7.
haha
Oh nothing, just realizing I can't export assets when set at 3x resolution. I have to drop back down to 1x and redraw my icons again if I want them to be pixel perfect.
Would it be the other way around?

I'm trying 2 different export methods, your 3x plugin and the PS export asset feature. When I shrink down from 3x with the plugin, it doesn't always divide perfectly, I get half pixels on assets like the following button (below). But the PS export feature actually sizes _up_, so I have to start at 1x then it multiplies up for me for 2x and 3x, which I just noticed works properly with redrawing (and makes sense since you can't get half numbers multiplying a whole number, but you can in dividing a whole number).
A file was shared
A file was shared
I think when it comes down to it, there isn't really any guesswork when starting at 1x

The funny part is when you upscale your psd from 1x to 2x or 3x, and then go back down, it doesn't revert to the original drawing precision, it ends up landing on half-pixels, adding to the confusion. I've gotta remember to undo to the point before I upsized instead of resizing again.
It's an uphill battle. Trying to relearn an appropriate workflow with all this.
Oh and I haven't figured out smart object nesting when I'm designing at 1x either, which is challenging.
(partially venting here, but more so sharing what I've learned with this whole 3x designing business so you all know what to expect in the future)
I see.
Not to sound like a broken record but this is where I would recommend using a spritesheet for your assets.
It's also good practice to manually re-draw icons for different resolutions. That gives you precise control over half pixels and any other inconsistencies.
I'll have to try this. I know you've mentioned it before. I haven't tried it yet. I'll have to give it a shot.
